full_text: From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov> @thedailybeast.com> Subject: Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein Sent: Sun, 11 Aug 2019 16:53:24 +0000 ... This graph is pretty explosive: A person with knowledge of the investigation said that when the decision was made to remove Mr. Epstein from suicide watch, the jail informed the Justice Department that Mr. Epstein would have a cellmate and that a guard "would look into his cell" every 30 minutes. But that was apparently not done, the person said. (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Senior Editor, writer The Daily Beast M: 267-257 (b)(6) Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: @ (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Sent: Sunday, August 11, 2019 12:52:21 PM To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov> Subject: Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein Hi, I know you are busy. Following up on this. Also wondering about a few details I see out there: was this already known? In addition, the jail had transferred his cellmate and allowed Mr. Epstein to be housed alone in a cell just two weeks after he had been taken off suicide watch, a decision that also violated the jail's normal procedure, two officials said. (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Senior Editor, writer The Daily Beast M: 267-257 (b)(6) Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: @ (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Sent: Saturday, August 10, 2019 3:17:52 PM To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov> Subject: Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein Thanks, Lee. 1. When was Epstein taken off suicide watch? 2. How long was he on suicide watch? 3. What unit in the jail was he housed? 4. Was he by himself? 5. What's protocol for watching him at 6:30 in the morning? And in general during a 24 hour period? 6. Is there an internal investigation? Are the guard(s) and/or supervisors placed on modified duty/or some sort of restricted duty while there is an ongoing investigation? 7. Are there surveillance cameras? If so what do they show? 8. What did he use to hang himself? (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Senior Editor, writer The Daily Beast M: 267-257 (b)(6)

text_blocks.content: From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov> @thedailybeast.com> Subject: Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein Sent: Sun, 11 Aug 2019 16:53:24 +0000

... This graph is pretty explosive: A person with knowledge of the investigation said that when the decision was made to remove Mr. Epstein from suicide watch, the jail informed the Justice Department that Mr. Epstein would have a cellmate and that a guard "would look into his cell" every 30 minutes. But that was apparently not done, the person said.
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Senior Editor, writer The Daily Beast M: 267-257 (b)(6) Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: @ (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Sent: Sunday, August 11, 2019 12:52:21 PM To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov> Subject: Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein

Hi, I know you are busy. Following up on this. Also wondering about a few details I see out there: was this already known? In addition, the jail had transferred his cellmate and allowed Mr. Epstein to be housed alone in a cell just two weeks after he had been taken off suicide watch, a decision that also violated the jail's normal procedure, two officials said.
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Senior Editor, writer The Daily Beast M: 267-257 (b)(6) Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: @ (b)(6), (b)(7)(C)
From: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Sent: Saturday, August 10, 2019 3:17:52 PM To: Lee Plourde (b)(6) @bop.gov> Subject: Re: Fwd: Jeffrey Epstein

Thanks, Lee. 1. When was Epstein taken off suicide watch? 2. How long was he on suicide watch? 3. What unit in the jail was he housed? 4. Was he by himself? 5. What's protocol for watching him at 6:30 in the morning? And in general during a 24 hour period? 6. Is there an internal investigation? Are the guard(s) and/or supervisors placed on modified duty/or some sort of restricted duty while there is an ongoing investigation? 7. Are there surveillance cameras? If so what do they show? 8. What did he use to hang himself?
(b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Senior Editor, writer The Daily Beast M: 267-257 (b)(6)

additional_notes: The document is an email chain discussing the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in jail. The emails contain redacted names and contact information. The document appears to be a factual report with some investigative questions.
